title: How to Make a Copyright Symbol on a Computer

steps.title: Copy and paste this symbol, as the quickest way:
steps.content: Copy and paste this symbol, as the quickest way: ©

steps.title: Use the auto-replace feature, if using Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Use the auto-replace feature, if using Microsoft Word. Just type ( + C + ) . Word will automatically enter the copyright symbol instead.

steps.title: Hold down ⌥ Option+G if using another program on a Mac.
steps.content: Hold down ⌥ Option + G if using another program on a Mac.

steps.title: Hold the Alt key and type 0169 in your number keypad if using another program on a Windows PC.
steps.content: Hold the Alt key and type 0169 in your number keypad if using another program on a Windows PC. It won't necessarily work if you use the numbers at the top of your keyboard. If you are using a laptop that has a function key (Fn) then hold down Alt + Fn as you type the numbers. You may need to have Numlock on for this to work. If none of these options work, try the Character Map method (below).

steps.title: Open the run dialog box by holding down the Windows and R key.
steps.content: Open the run dialog box by holding down the Windows and R key.

steps.title: Type in charmap.exe and hit ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type in charmap.exe and hit ↵ Enter . You will be presented with a character map

steps.title: Click on "Advanced view", if not already open.
steps.content: Click on "Advanced view", if not already open.

steps.title: Select the character, copy it.
steps.content: Select the character, copy it. Paste it to your required file.
